headline: Tesla Stock Could Be Headed for a Breakout Despite Weak Europe Sales
summary: Tesla  has once again attracted significant attention—and not in a good way—when the most recent data showed sales dropping by 40% in July.  Going back to Friday, Tesla stock gained 6% amid a broad-market rally and then rose 2% on Monday, even though the  S&P 500 fell 0.4%.  With the stock down 1.6% at $344.05, Tesla still has some work to do.

headline: Tesla sales plunge again in Europe as anger at Musk keeps buyers away for 7th month in a row
summary: Europeans angry at Elon Musk still aren't buying his cars months after the billionaire predicted a “major rebound” in Tesla sales, data released Thursday shows.  Tesla sales plunged 40% in July in the 27 European Union countries compared with the year earlier even as sales overall of electric vehicle soared, according to the European Automobile Manufacturers’ Association.  Meanwhile sales of Chinese rival BYD continued to climb fast, grabbing 1.1% market share of all car sales in the month versus Tesla's 0.7%.

raw.headline: Tesla sales plunge again in Europe as anger at Musk keeps buyers away for 7th month in a row

Meanwhile sales of Chinese rival BYD continued to climb fast, grabbing 1.1% market share of all car sales in the month versus Tesla's 0.7%.

headline: Tesla's Europe sales crater 40% in July as BYD, competitors gain
summary:
Tesla's troubles across the pond in Europe are worsening.
Per the European Automobile Manufacturers' Association, Tesla EV registrations (a proxy for sales) in Europe fell to just 8,837 units in July, a 40.2% drop compared to a year ago. Meanwhile, overall EV registrations in the region, which includes the UK and the European Free Trade Association, rose 33.6% in July, with overall registrations up 5.9%.

raw.headline: Tesla's Europe sales crater 40% in July as BYD, competitors gain
raw.summary:
Tesla's troubles across the pond in Europe are worsening.
Per the European Automobile Manufacturers' Association, Tesla EV registrations (a proxy for sales) in Europe fell to just 8,837 units in July, a 40.2% drop compared to a year ago. Meanwhile, overall EV registrations in the region, which includes the UK and the European Free Trade Association, rose 33.6% in July, with overall registrations up 5.9%.

headline: BMW CEO says 'can't afford mistakes' ahead of EV launch
summary: STORY: BMW’s CEO warned Thursday that the car industry "can’t afford mistakes" as it shifts towards electric vehicles. The German automaker, boss Oliver Zipse said, is betting heavily on its revamped EV offering. He told Spiegel news magazine that there will be “a selection process” in the sector in the coming years as EVs become prominent. This, he said, was why the German carmaker decided five years ago to overhaul its portfolio with the fully electric "Neue Klasse" series.The firm hopes to catch up with EV pioneer Tesla.BMW will unveil the first model in the series, the iX3, at the Munich car show next week.An analyst highlighted BMW’s risk, as a relatively small producer, in focusing on electric. Branding it “enormously important that a billion-euro investment doesn't go down the drain.”

raw.headline: BMW CEO says 'can't afford mistakes' ahead of EV launch
raw.summary: STORY: BMW’s CEO warned Thursday that the car industry "can’t afford mistakes" as it shifts towards electric vehicles. The German automaker, boss Oliver Zipse said, is betting heavily on its revamped EV offering. He told Spiegel news magazine that there will be “a selection process” in the sector in the coming years as EVs become prominent. This, he said, was why the German carmaker decided five years ago to overhaul its portfolio with the fully electric "Neue Klasse" series.The firm hopes to catch up with EV pioneer Tesla.BMW will unveil the first model in the series, the iX3, at the Munich car show next week.An analyst highlighted BMW’s risk, as a relatively small producer, in focusing on electric. Branding it “enormously important that a billion-euro investment doesn't go down the drain.”

headline: China’s BYD Speeds Past Tesla in Europe
summary: BYD is taking Tesla's place as the electric-vehicle disruptor in the European car market.  In July, the Chinese company outsold Elon Musk's EV pioneer in the region, according to data released Thursday by the European Automobile Manufacturers’ Association, known as ACEA.  It was the first time ACEA included BYD in its monthly data dump.

It was the first time ACEA included BYD in its monthly data dump.

headline: BMW CEO says 'can't afford mistakes' ahead of fully electric launch
summary: BERLIN (Reuters) -BMW chief executive Oliver Zipse expects a reordering of the car industry in the coming years, warning in an interview on Thursday that the sector cannot afford mistakes, as the company bets heavily on its revamped electric vehicle offering.  "There will be a selection process in our industry," Zipse told the Spiegel news magazine.  This, he said, was why the German carmaker decided five years ago to overhaul its portfolio with the new, fully electric 'Neue Klasse' series, with which it hopes to catch up with EV pioneer Tesla.
